alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Kinney; Maverick; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 23 at 7:28PM CST until January 24 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected Tuesday Afternoon and Early Evening across the Rio Grande Plains... .Much drier air as well as strong and gusty west to northwest winds will develop Tuesday afternoon across the Rio Grande Plains behind a cold front. Minimum relative humidity in the teens are forecast at the same time sustained winds of 25 to 30 mph are occurring, with higher gusts likely. Despite chances for rainfall Tuesday morning, the combination of these weather conditions, as well as winter cured grasses, will result in a critical fire weather afternoon and evening on Tuesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CST TUESDAY FOR STRONG WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CST Tuesday. * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Dimmit; Kinney; Maverick; Val Verde; Zavala
